intro: Grammitis abebaion, commonly known as the African chain fern, is a tropical fern species native to Africa. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, linear fronds that resemble chains, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Grammitis abebaion plays a role in maintaining ecological balance by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability in its native regions.
